benchmark_details.name: MMIT-Dataset (Multimodal Implicit Toxicity Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: The MMIT-Dataset comprises 2,100 multimodal statements and prompts across 7 risk categories and 31 sub-categories to advance the detection of multimodal implicit toxicity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that facilitates the study and detection of multimodal implicit toxicity in text-image content.

data.source: Constructed through collaboration with LVLMs, diffusion models, and human involvement.
data.annotation: Manual review by professional annotators, with some automated checks performed using LVLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the predictions made by ShieldVLM and compared to ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: A safety prediction is considered correct if its predicted label aligns with the ground-truth safety label.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared with industry-standard models including OpenAI Multimodal Content Moderation.
methodology.validation: Validated using a combination of manual and automatic checks to ensure alignment with safety guidelines.
